alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Kaibab Plateau; Northern Gila County; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 23 at 2:55AM MST until February 23 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches above 5000 feet and 8 to 14 inches possible above 6500 feet. Locally higher amounts will be possible along the highest terrain of the Mogollon Rim. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Areas near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Forest Lakes, Fredonia, Heber-Overgaard, Jacob Lake, Payson, Pine- Strawberry, Shonto and Williams. * WHEN...Until 6 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will become very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow will cause areas of poor visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Wednesday morning and evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected to occur this morning into the early afternoon. Additional snow forecast from 2 AM Today to 6 PM Today: Doney Park 4 to 8 inches Flagstaff 6 to 10 inches Forest Lakes 9 to 15 inches Fredonia 1 to 2 inches Heber-Overgaard 4 to 8 inches Jacob Lake 2 to 4 inches Payson 4 to 8 inches Pine-Strawberry 7 to 11 inches Shonto 1 to 3 inches Williams 4 to 8 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Black Mesa Area; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Kaibab Plateau; Northern Gila County; Western Mogollon Rim
